wikipedia_page.main: Philip Howard Frere (1813–1868) was an English academic and writer on agricultural matters.

response: Frere was born in Cambridge, England, on 23 November 1863, the younger son of Philip Howard Frere and his wife Emily, née Gipps. His siblings were Arthur, Ellen and Lucy. Lucy became the wife of Wilfred J. Barnes. He was educated at Trinity College, Cambridge and Wells Theological College; and ordained in 1889.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1929/30 p 1311 His first post was as a curate at Stepney Parish Church. He was Examining Chaplain to the Bishop of Southwark from 1896The Morning Post (38859). London. 23 December 1896. p. 3. to 1909.
He married in 1810 Mary, daughter of Brampton Gurdon Dillingham. Philip Howard Frere was their son. During Frere's time, chiefly through his wife, Downing College was a social centre at Cambridge.
